meanings.definition: To broadcast or transmit a television program or signal.
meanings.sent1: The TV station will be telecasting the live concert tonight.
meanings.sent2: They telecasted the news bulletin to viewers across the country.
meanings.sent3: The aliens found Earth's telecasting of reality shows quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her smile telecasted her joy to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city telecasted a sense of excitement and energy.

meanings.definition: The act of broadcasting or transmitting a television program or signal.
meanings.sent1: Telecasting has become a popular form of entertainment in many households.
meanings.sent2: The telecasting of sports events attracts a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The telecasting of the cooking competition made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like a telecasting of happiness to all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The telecasting of breaking news kept viewers glued to their screens.
